org.vertx.java.core.http

Interface HttpServer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    NetworkSupport<HttpServer>, ServerSSLSupport<HttpServer>, ServerTCPSupport<HttpServer>, SSLSupport<HttpServer>, TCPSupport<HttpServer>

    public interface HttpServer
extends ServerSSLSupport<HttpServer>, ServerTCPSupport<HttpServer>
    An HTTP and WebSockets server

    If an instance is instantiated from an event loop then the handlers of the instance will always be called on that same event loop. If an instance is instantiated from some other arbitrary Java thread then an event loop will be assigned to the instance and used when any of its handlers are called.

    Instances of HttpServer are thread-safe.

    • Method Detail

      • requestHandler

        HttpServer requestHandler(Handler<HttpServerRequest> requestHandler)
        Set the request handler for the server to requestHandler. As HTTP requests are received by the server, instances of HttpServerRequest will be created and passed to this handler.
        Returns:
        a reference to this, so methods can be chained.

      • requestHandler

        Handler<HttpServerRequest> requestHandler()
        Get the request handler
        Returns:
        The request handler

      • websocketHandler

        HttpServer websocketHandler(Handler<ServerWebSocket> wsHandler)
        Set the websocket handler for the server to wsHandler. If a websocket connect handshake is successful a new ServerWebSocket instance will be created and passed to the handler.
        Returns:
        a reference to this, so methods can be chained.

      • websocketHandler

        Handler<ServerWebSocket> websocketHandler()
        Get the websocket handler
        Returns:
        The websocket handler

      • listen

        HttpServer listen(int port)
        Tell the server to start listening on all available interfaces and port port. Be aware this is an async operation and the server may not bound on return of the method.

      • listen

        HttpServer listen(int port,
                  Handler<AsyncResult<HttpServer>> listenHandler)
        Tell the server to start listening on all available interfaces and port port

      • listen

        HttpServer listen(int port,
                  java.lang.String host)
        Tell the server to start listening on port port and hostname or ip address given by host. Be aware this is an async operation and the server may not bound on return of the method.

      • listen

        HttpServer listen(int port,
                  java.lang.String host,
                  Handler<AsyncResult<HttpServer>> listenHandler)
        Tell the server to start listening on port port and hostname or ip address given by host.

      • close

        void close()
        Close the server. Any open HTTP connections will be closed.

      • close

        void close(Handler<AsyncResult<java.lang.Void>> doneHandler)
        Close the server. Any open HTTP connections will be closed. The doneHandler will be called when the close is complete.

      • setCompressionSupported

        HttpServer setCompressionSupported(boolean compressionSupported)
        Set if the HttpServer should compress the http response if the connected client supports it.

      • isCompressionSupported

        boolean isCompressionSupported()
        Returns true if the HttpServer should compress the http response if the connected client supports it.

      • setMaxWebSocketFrameSize

        HttpServer setMaxWebSocketFrameSize(int maxSize)
        Sets the maximum websocket frame size in bytes. Default is 65536 bytes.
        Parameters:
        maxSize - The size in bytes

      • getMaxWebSocketFrameSize

        int getMaxWebSocketFrameSize()
        Get the maximum websocket frame size in bytes.

      • setWebSocketSubProtocols

        HttpServer setWebSocketSubProtocols(java.lang.String... subProtocols)
        Set the supported websocket subprotocols. Using null to disable support of subprotocols.

      • getWebSocketSubProtocols

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getWebSocketSubProtocols()
        Returns a immutable Set which holds all the supported subprotocols. An empty set is returned if non are supported. This is the default.
